resources.string: Pull down to refresh the project list.
There is no other information available for this inspection
Click an agency to edit login details."
Sign in as you would at %s. Login info will differ from Civic ID.
You\'ll be able to add more agencies when you\'re through with your first.
Please input your username and password!
You have successfully connected this account.
We were not able to find this user account. Please check your user name and try again, or contact this agency for support.
We experienced an error connecting to this account. Please try again.
Some required fields were missing. Please complete all required fields and try again.
The passwords you entered do not match. Please try again.
Just a minute while we gather account info from your Civic ID agencies,
Click another city to add that agency or click Done above to move on.
Do you want to remove this agency?
%s has been removed from this app.
Are you sure you want to cancel this inspection? Cancelation fees may apply.
Are you sure you want to reschedule this inspection? Reschedule fees may apply.
You are currently signed in to your %s account.
Google map isn\'t supported by your device
You do not have permission to schedule this inspection!
Please input on site contact details!
Instant Updates on Inspections and Projects
Project Pages track permit, contacts, payments, and more
Earliest available time slots are automatically shown to get your work done faster
Get simple inspection results at a glance so you can manage projects faster
Focus on the job at hand with quick access to a permit\'s contacts, professionals, and dues; all in one place.
Call or e-mail Inspectors simply to get more information about an inspection result.

In no event will Accela be liable for any direct, indirect, special, punitive, exemplary or consequential losses or damages of whatsoever kind arising out of your use or access to the Software Application, including loss of profit or the like whether or not in the contemplation of the parties, whether based on breach of contract, tort (including negligence), product liability or otherwise. 11.2. No party to this Agreement will bring a legal action under this TOU more than one year after the cause of action arose. Each party waives its rights to a jury trial in any resulting litigation.

The use of the Software Application is subject to this Privacy Policy, which is incorporated into and made a part of the Terms of Use, and governs the handling of personal and non-personal information from all users.
The following information explains the use of information provided in conjunction with the use of the Software Application and should be read before submitting information. Accela reserves the right to make changes to this Policy and our practices may be changed. All changes will be posted and changes will only apply to activities and information on a prospective basis. Your use of the Software Application confirms your acceptance the practices described in this Policy. If at any time you do not agree to be subject to any modified Privacy Policy, you may no longer use the Software Application.
By providing any personal information to Accela, You acknowledge and hereby unambiguously consent to the transfer to, collection and processing of such information. You may not use the Software Application if you do not agree to such transfer to, collection, and processing of your personal information in the United States.
Personally identifiable information, such as email addresses, names, postal addresses, etc., is only collected when voluntarily submitted by users of the site and will be used in accordance with this Policy.

The Software Application may use cookie and tracking technology depending on the features offered. Cookie and tracking technology are useful for gathering information about the use of the Software Application. Cookies cannot collect Personal information, but if you have provided personally identifiable previously, cookies can be linked to such information. We reserve the right to share cookie and tracking information with third parties.

Information may be provided to governmental agencies or private entities assisting in fraud prevention or investigation: to prevent unauthorized transactions or protect against actual or potential fraud; to investigate fraud; or as otherwise permitted or required by law. The information is provided under the condition that it is utilized for the specifically established purpose.
Your personally identifiable information/payment information is only accessible to authorized employees, agents and contractors who have expressly agreed to keep the information confidential.
